channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Omagh bomb: 'Real prospect attack could have been prevented'
item.description: A judge also calls for new investigations into the Real IRA attack which killed 29 people.

item.title: Covid-19: 'More than 60% admitted to hospital not vaccinated'
item.description: The medical director of the Belfast Trust said the health service was facing significant pressure.

item.title: Brexit: More than 2,000 medicines face withdrawal over Protocol
item.description: Some firms will stop supplying medicines when a grace period ends, says pharmaceutical group.

item.title: Teenager pulled from Lough Sheelin dies in hospital
item.description: The teenager was the fifth person to die in lakes on the island of Ireland in the last week.

item.title: Brexit: 'Clear opportunities and frictions' in NI Protocol, says Invest NI
item.description: There is clarity for firms considering investment in Northern Ireland, says the boss of Invest NI.

item.title: Reimagining Northern Ireland's cities after lockdown
item.description: Developments like parklets reflect the permanent ways the pandemic is changing our spaces.

item.title: Concussion: Father calls for mandatory brain injury lessons
item.description: A father of a 14-year-old who died after a school rugby match says dangers must be highlighted.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Philip Doyle and Hannah Scott into repechage
item.description: Team Ireland's Philip Doyle and Team GB's Hannah Scott both fail to make it through their initial rowing heats on Day 1 of the Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ireland's women's hockey team's journey to their first Games
item.description: BBC Sport NI looks into the journey of the Ireland women's hockey team ahead of their first Olympic Games

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Japanese artists reimagine countries as anime samurai
item.description: The creators have used the flags of competing nations as inspiration to design Japanese warriors.

item.title: Extreme Heat: NI temperature record broken for third time in a week
item.description: A weather station in the city of Armagh recorded a high of 31.4 C on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Covid-19: Theatre and concert hall decision in NI delayed
item.description: The NI Executive has agreed to relax some Covid restrictions including numbers who can meet outdoors.

item.title: Abortion in NI: Westminster directs Stormont to set up services
item.description: Westminster has intervened with a formal direction requiring Stormont to commission services.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: No further deaths but 1,430 positive cases in NI
item.description: There are currently 162 patients with Covid-19 in NI hospitals, ten of whom are in intensive care.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern Trust suspends hospital visits as cases spike
item.description: The decision was taken as NI recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus cases since January.

item.title: Interim Covid vaccine certificates to be launched for NI travellers
item.description: Anyone travelling from Northern Ireland after the 25 July should wait to use a new app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitality Ulster calls for NI recovery strategy
item.description: Industry representatives say businesses are struggling after lockdown and need help from Stormont.

item.title: NI's trio of female rowers looking for Tokyo glory
item.description: Northern Ireland's trio of female rowers - Rebecca Shorten, Hannah Scott and Rebecca Edwards - tell BBC Sport NI about their journey to Tokyo and their ambitions at the Games

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Is NI's marathon success by accident or design?
item.description: Stephen Scullion, Kevin Seaward and Paul Pollock will form an entirely Northern Irish line-up in Ireland's Olympic men's marathon challenge.

item.title: Extreme heat: NI records hottest day ever for second time in week
item.description: The thermometer hit 31.3C in Castlederg on Wednesday, says the Met Office.

item.title: Heatwaves: What do they do to the body and who is at risk?
item.description: What impact do high temperatures have on our bodies?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Rhys McClenaghan takes inspiration from Mary Peters on Olympic journey
item.description: Gymnast Rhys McClenaghan tells BBC Sport NI that he hopes winning Olympic gold in Tokyo this summer will help inspire the next generation of Northern Irish gymnasts.

item.title: The parklets popping up in Belfast city centre
item.description: Spaces for car parking are being turned into places for people on the Ormeau Road and Linenhall Street.

item.title: 'Our lives just finished then'
item.description: A report concludes there were failures in the investigation into the murder of a teenager in 1993.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson's sister calls for public inquiry
item.description: Arlene Arkinson's sister says she had been unable to come to terms with her sister's murder.

item.title: Axa Insurance: Company announces 60 new jobs for Londonderry
item.description: The new jobs will take the firm's workforce in the north west to more than 600.

item.title: Arlene Arkinson 'let down by criminal justice system'
item.description: An ex-detective who took over the inquiry says police should apologise for searching a family home.

item.title: Nanotechnology: Seagate-led NI consortium wins £42m grant
item.description: The grant will allow firms to develop new technology for medical devices, communication and storage.

item.title: Londonderry: Department for Infrastructure depot staff go on strike
item.description: Unite the Union says the strike action is over how the department handles staff complaints.

item.title: Emily Ratajkowski sponsors Bantry Basketball Club in County Cork
item.description: Emily Ratajkowski buys kit for Bantry's U15 and U16 teams, setting Snapchat "on fire".

item.title: Drownings: Two deaths in counties Leitrim and Cavan
item.description: Gardaí say there is no foul play suspected in either of the separate incidents on Wednesday.

item.title: Covid-19: ROI indoor hospitality to resume on 26 July
item.description: Customers will not be subject to time limits and closing time will be set at 23:30.

item.title: Des O'Malley: Founder of Ireland's Progressive Democrats dies
item.description: Originally a member of Fianna Fáil, Mr O'Malley held a number of ministerial posts during his career.

item.title: Bessborough: Second refusal for flats at mother and baby home
item.description: Former residents welcome refusal to allow residential development at the County Cork site.
